author: Daniel Greene
description:
🩸 Empire of the Vampire by Jay Kristoff is a brutal, blood-soaked epic of faith, vengeance, and monsters — both human and not.
In this review, I break down whether this vampire-slaying saga is a gothic fantasy.

We’ll talk:

Non-linear storytelling — does it work?

Gabriel de León: the last Silversaint or a gothic edgelord?

Religion, art, and Kristoff’s unapologetic grimdark style

If you’re into The Black Company, Witcher, or just want vampires with heavy lore — this one’s worth checking out… probably.

💬 Let me know in the comments: was this your jam or just overhyped?

title: Why EMPIRE OF THE VAMPIRE Works!
